Since technically this is a gaming blog as well as a music blog (I almost never post about gaming, though), I thought I'd share one of my own creations with the world - a Java version of Conway's "Game of Life".

You can download it HERE</a>.

You'll need Java to run it, but most people have a version (grab it here</a>). Just press each button to set the starting squares and hit space to start the game. Press space again to end it.

The rules are relatively simple:

  • a space gives birth to a cell next turn if it surrounded by 3 other cells.</li>
  • a cell dies next turn if surrounded by less than 2 cells (freezes) or more than 3 (overcrowding)</li>
    </ul>

    There are some pretty fun patterns to be made, and I find it pretty hypnotizing to watch it grow and fluctuate! The Wikipedia article</a> has some details about the mathematics, history, and interesting patterns (including ones that spawn and self-replicate).</div>
